title: Polymorphism
subject: Java
theory:
Polymorphism = Many Forms.

**Runtime Polymorphism**: When a method call is resolved at runtime.
Achieved by **Method Overriding**: Child class provides specific implementation of a method already defined in Parent.

examples.explanation: Code working on 'List' interface works for both implementations.

common_mistakes.correction: Static methods cannot be overridden (Method Hiding). Mapping happens at compile time.

interview_questions.question: Can we override private methods?
interview_questions.answer: No. They are not visible to subclass.

practice_problems.problem: Create Shape class with draw(), override in Circle/Square.

real_world_use_cases.description: Application defines 'Plugin' interface. Any 3rd party class implementing it can be loaded.
